paper_abstract: In his Neues Organon of 1764, the mathematician and astronomer Jean-Henri Lambert 1121 developed a theory of probable syllogisms, with the aim of formally describing the probabilist reasoning and then applying it to the probability of testimony, thus imparting an epistemic sense to the concept of probability. In the present text, we propose to study the principles of this theory and the difficulties it raises. (C) 2009 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.
paper_title: J.-H. Lambert's theory of probable syllogisms
